ygData.subject: Maven rc2 (Was: Re: [archive-crawler] Problem with the 0.7.1 heritrix distribution made by "maven dist")
ygData.msgSnippet: Turns our the below error was because of the way our jetty jar was named (org.mortbay.jetty-4.2.17.jar).  It was illegal as a MANIFEST.MF key entry.  I renamed

From: Michael Stack <stack@...>
Subject: Maven rc2 (Was: Re: [archive-crawler] Problem with the 0.7.1 heritrix
 distribution made by "maven dist")
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=168599281

Turns our the below error was because of the way our jetty jar was named 
(org.mortbay.jetty-4.2.17.jar).  It was illegal as a MANIFEST.MF key 
entry.  I renamed it as plain jetty-4.2.17.jar and now heritrix builds 
without issue using maven-1.0-rc2.
St.Ack

S�ren Vejrup Carlsen wrote:

>Dear Michael.
>My failure to start heritrix is caused by some problem with the MANIFEST.MF
>created by the jar program.
>If I unzip heritrix-0.7.1.jar and then include the unzip directory in the
>classpath in bin/heritrix
>It works fine.
>Could it be, that maven here require some specific jar-functionality only
>supported by some JVM's.
>
>Regards
>
>--------------------------------------
>heritrix-0.7.1.jar/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF:
>--------------------------------------
>Manifest-Version: 1.0
>Ant-Version: Apache Ant 1.5.3
>Created-By: Apache Jakarta Maven
>Built-By: svc
>Package: org.archive
>Build-Jdk: 1.4.1
>Extension-Name: heritrix
>Specification-Title:
>  An open-source, extensible, web-scale, archival-quality web crawler
>project.
>
>Specification-Vendor: Internet Archive
>Specification-Version: 0.7.1

>
>
>I have no explaination for why you'd get the below exception (Looks like
>jetty trying to find main but it can't because not on classpath
>according to URL classloader).
>
>Do you get same error if no wrapper script?  ("% ./bin/heritrix
>--selftest")?  Do you get same error if you use a built binary?  Did the
>build have any errors?
>
>(I just tried a build.  I also used your wrapper script successfully
>going against SUN and IBM JVMs.)
>
>St.Ack
>
>
>
>S�ren Vejrup Carlsen wrote:
>
>  
>
>>Dear All.
>>After having made a checkout from from CVS, and made the distributions
>>using 'maven dist',
>>I get the following error:
>>
>>[heritrix@asterix heritrix]$ bash heritrix_run.sh
>>java.io.IOException: invalid header field name:
>>org.mortbay.jetty-Extension-Name
>>       at java.util.jar.Attributes.read(Attributes.java(Compiled Code))
>>       at java.util.jar.Manifest.read(Manifest.java:174)
>>       at java.util.jar.Manifest.<init>(Manifest.java:64)
>>       at java.util.jar.JarFile.getManifest(JarFile.java:203)
>>       at
>>sun.misc.URLClassPath$JarLoader.getClassPath(URLClassPath.java:860)
>>       at sun.misc.URLClassPath.getLoader(URLClassPath.java:338)
>>       at sun.misc.URLClassPath.getResource(URLClassPath.java:192)
>>       at
>>    
>>
>java.net.URLClassLoader$ClassFinder.run(URLClassLoader.java:809)
>  
>
>>       at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
>>       at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:336)
>>       at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:552)
>>       at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:428)
>>       at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:484)
>>The java class is not found:  org/archive/crawler/Heritrix
>>
>>
>>Note: I use here my own wrapper in front of the heritrix wrapper:
>>################### heritrix_run.sh #######################
>>
>>HERITRIX_HOME=/home/heritrix/heritrix-0.7.1
>>JAVA_HOME=/usr/local/java
>>JAVA_OPTS=-Xmx256MB
>>export HERITRIX_HOME JAVA_HOME JAVA_OPTS
>>$HERITRIX_HOME/bin/foreground_heritrix --port=8079 --admin
>>=<some-uid:some-passwd>
>>
>>
>>Can you tell me, what I am doing wrong here?
>>
